data.title: Amir Wallace - Football
data.meta_description:
Amir Wallace (7) Cornerback  - JUNIOR (2022)


	Appeared in five games, starting three of them for the Toreros
	Recorded 13 tackles (12 solo), 2.5 TFL, recovered

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

JUNIOR (2022)

Appeared in five games, starting three of them for the Toreros

Recorded 13 tackles (12 solo), 2.5 TFL, recovered a fumble and broke up three passes

Had a 43-yard kick return and a 52-yard punt return on his two chances

Recorded five solo tackles and picked up a fumble against Cal Poly on September 10

SOPHOMORE (2021)

Honored on the Phil Steele FCS All-Pioneer League Third Team.

Named to the All-PFL Honorable mention

Played in all 11 games.

Accumulated 39 total tackles (27 solo, 12 assists) with 10 pass breakups.

Recorded a carrer-tying five solo tackles against Montana State (Sept. 18)

SOPHOMORE (2020)

Played in all six games in the Spring at Cornerback.

Totaled 23 total tackles (14 solo, nine assisted) with five Quarterback hurries and 2.5 Sacks

Against Stetson (Apr. 10) had a season-high five solo tackles and two pass breakups.

Ranked fifth on squad with 14 solo tackles.

FRESHMAN (2019)

Played in 8 games as a cornerback as a true freshman

8 tackles, INT and a pass break-up

6 of his 8 games played came during the PFL schedule

Season-high 4 tackles and interception vs. Drake (Nov. 2)

3 solo tackles vs. Morehead State (Nov. 16)

HIGH SCHOOL

De La Salle was three-time state runner-up in 2016-17-18

Ranked No. 4 in the nation in 2018

Earned first team All-East Bay Athletic League, All-Metro and All-NorCal in 2018

Participated in track; named most improved in 2017, received Coaches Award in 2018 and selected MVP in 2019

PERSONAL

Son of Augie Wallace and Juanda Harris

Has twin brother Zamir who is also on the USD team and younger brother Nikko; Amir and Zamir are both defensive backs
